channel.title: Comments on: The Pale Light of the Greater Moon

item.title: By: By the Light of the Moon! at MMOG Nation
item.dc:creator: By the Light of the Moon! at MMOG Nation
item.description: [...] As a newly reminted citizen of Azeroth, and someone who appreciates Asian culture, I am enthralled by the neatness of the Lunar Festival. AFK Gamer has a quick rundown on the details, and an extensive Flickr gallery of the scenery. The official site, of course, has the real deal with Bill McNeal. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] As a newly reminted citizen of Azeroth, and someone who appreciates Asian culture, I am enthralled by the neatness of the Lunar Festival. AFK Gamer has a quick rundown on the details, and an extensive Flickr gallery of the scenery. The official site, of course, has the real deal with Bill McNeal. […]

item.title: By: Chai
item.dc:creator: Chai
item.description:
I happened to stumble on this site from Grumpy Gamer's site when I noticed this post on the Lunar Festival. I just have to give kudos to Blizzard for adding that little mail message from the elders that you've visited with Lucky Red Envelopes. This comes very close to the Chinese New Year tradition of giving out lai-see (lucky money in red envelopes).
Even though there seems to be a lot of added lag, this has definitely been an interesting event.
item.content:encoded:
I happened to stumble on this site from Grumpy Gamer’s site when I noticed this post on the Lunar Festival. I just have to give kudos to Blizzard for adding that little mail message from the elders that you’ve visited with Lucky Red Envelopes. This comes very close to the Chinese New Year tradition of giving out lai-see (lucky money in red envelopes).

Even though there seems to be a lot of added lag, this has definitely been an interesting event.

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
Bit more on this topic, if you're looking to get additional coin rewards beyond the obvious 5 near major flightpaths, <a href="http://thottbot.com/?i=52678" rel="nofollow">thottbot has some good posts</a> on coin elder locations with specific locs and narratives to find the elders. (The <a href="http://thottbot.com/?ccb=1&v=454153" rel="nofollow">post by jtoebes</a> is particularly helpful -- he recommends <a href="http://www.wowwiki.com/Elders" rel="nofollow">this list at the WoW wiki</a>.)
There are 50 coins in total, and while I won't be collecting all 50, as long as I'm passing by an elder, might as well grab a coin.
Most coins (even in hostile/cross-factioned areas) can be collected without combat, although it doesn't hurt to be a sneaking rogue or dr00d.
EDIT: My comment about hostile/cross-factioned areas is applicable to PvE servers only. Those PvP realm people have additional challenges to collecting coins, OBVIOUSLY.
item.content:encoded:
Bit more on this topic, if you’re looking to get additional coin rewards beyond the obvious 5 near major flightpaths, thottbot has some good posts on coin elder locations with specific locs and narratives to find the elders. (The post by jtoebes is particularly helpful — he recommends this list at the WoW wiki.)

There are 50 coins in total, and while I won’t be collecting all 50, as long as I’m passing by an elder, might as well grab a coin.

Most coins (even in hostile/cross-factioned areas) can be collected without combat, although it doesn’t hurt to be a sneaking rogue or dr00d.

EDIT: My comment about hostile/cross-factioned areas is applicable to PvE servers only. Those PvP realm people have additional challenges to collecting coins, OBVIOUSLY.

item.title: By: Indy
item.dc:creator: Indy
item.description:
One of the best things about this quest, for a low level character, is the ability to pick up the Darnassus (for human/dwarf/gnome) flightpoints or IF/Stormwind flightpoints (for night elves) without the suicide run through the Wetlands. And even for somewhat higher levels, getting the flight path for Moonglade before your forties (non-druids) is nice.
The alliance reputation given for each coin received is nice, and a major incentive for me and probably quite a few others. I love these bonus holiday type quests that give reputation rewards.
Never go on an adventure without a hat! Indy
item.content:encoded:
One of the best things about this quest, for a low level character, is the ability to pick up the Darnassus (for human/dwarf/gnome) flightpoints or IF/Stormwind flightpoints (for night elves) without the suicide run through the Wetlands. And even for somewhat higher levels, getting the flight path for Moonglade before your forties (non-druids) is nice.

The alliance reputation given for each coin received is nice, and a major incentive for me and probably quite a few others. I love these bonus holiday type quests that give reputation rewards.

Never go on an adventure without a hat!
Indy

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
Ya, that's true, it's mad mad mad exp for very little effort. Considering that, plus the kinky rewards and the lunar decorations, these special events are truly what Blizzard does best.
@Troggdor -- Great video link. Watched it twice, lol'd each time.
item.content:encoded:
Ya, that’s true, it’s mad mad mad exp for very little effort. Considering that, plus the kinky rewards and the lunar decorations, these special events are truly what Blizzard does best.

@Troggdor — Great video link. Watched it twice, lol’d each time.

item.title: By: Brent Michael Krupp
item.dc:creator: Brent Michael Krupp
item.description: One of the best things about this is that if you do the basic quest to visit Moonglade for the festival (throw 10 fireworks, get the teleport scroll, talk to a guy in Moonglade) you get about 4800xp. Even if you are level 5! All my lowbie alts just made 1 or 2 levels for just the 4 silver that the fireworks cost.
item.content:encoded: One of the best things about this is that if you do the basic quest to visit Moonglade for the festival (throw 10 fireworks, get the teleport scroll, talk to a guy in Moonglade) you get about 4800xp. Even if you are level 5! All my lowbie alts just made 1 or 2 levels for just the 4 silver that the fireworks cost.

item.title: By: Erunamo
item.dc:creator: Erunamo
item.description: I find it ironic that the most peaceful place in all of Azeroth, Moonglade, is now ridden with corpses.
item.content:encoded: I find it ironic that the most peaceful place in all of Azeroth, Moonglade, is now ridden with corpses.

item.title: By: tyleulen
item.dc:creator: tyleulen
item.description: There is a non druid alliance flight point in Moonglade, on the south side of the lake near where the big raid puppie boss spawns.
item.content:encoded: There is a non druid alliance flight point in Moonglade, on the south side of the lake near where the big raid puppie boss spawns.
